player
Interface IPlayer

All Known Implementing Classes:
Player
public interface IPlayer

A Player is the main actor of the game. It can move round, pick up objects and tries to win the game

Method Summary
 void endTurn()
          This method ends the turn of this player.
 int getAllowedNumberOfActions()
          Returns the allowed number of actions the player has left in this turn.

          Returns the coordinate this player currently stands on.

          Returns the unique ID-number associated with this player.

          Returns the Inventory-content associated with this player.

skipNumberOfActions

void skipNumberOfActions(int numberOfActionsToSkip)
This method lets the player lose a specified number of actions.

Parameters:
numberOfActionsToSkip - The number of actions this player will skip

hasMovedYet

boolean hasMovedYet()
Return whether or not this player has already done a move action during this turn.

Returns:
whether this player has already moved

endTurn

void endTurn()
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
This method ends the turn of this player. This player will lose the game if this method is called before he did a move action, (i.e. if this.hasMovedYet() is false when calling this method, this player loses the game).

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - The end turn preconditions must be satisfied, i.e. isPreconditionEndTurnSatisfied()

isPreconditionEndTurnSatisfied

boolean isPreconditionEndTurnSatisfied()
Returns whether this player is allowed to perform an end turn action. A player is allowed to perform an end turn action if he has performed less then Player.MAX_NUMBER_OF_ACTIONS_PER_TURN in his current turn, getAllowedNumberOfActions() > 0.

Returns:
whether this player is allowed to perform an end turn action.

moveInDirection

void moveInDirection(Direction direction)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            IllegalMoveException
This method moves the player one square in the specified Direction.

Parameters:
direction - the direction to move in
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - The move preconditions must be satisfied, i.e. this. isPreconditionMoveSatisfied(). The grid must allow the player to do the move, i.e. canMoveFromCoordInDirection(this.getCurrentLocation(), direction)
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The specified direction must be a valid direction for this player to try to move in, i.e. isValidDirection(Direction).
IllegalMoveException - TODO

isPreconditionMoveSatisfied

boolean isPreconditionMoveSatisfied()
Returns whether this player is allowed to perform a move action. A player is allowed to perform an move action if he has performed less then Player.MAX_NUMBER_OF_ACTIONS_PER_TURN in his current turn, getAllowedNumberOfActions() > 0.

Returns:
whether this player is allowed to perform a move action

isValidDirection

boolean isValidDirection(Direction direction)
Returns whether a specified direction is a valid direction for this player to try to move in. A player can try to move in every non-null direction.

Parameters:
direction - the direction the player wants to check
Returns:
whether a specified direction is a valid direction for this player to try to move in

pickUpItem

void pickUpItem(IItem item)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Pick up the given item. The item must be on the square the player is currently on.

Parameters:
item - The item to pick up.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The item must be on the square the player is currently on and cannot be null.

useItem

void useItem(IItem i)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Use the given item. The item must be in the inventory of the player.

Parameters:
i - The item that will be used.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The item is not in the inventory
